result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Melissa M Robison

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 14, 2022 at 10:30 am.

10:52 a.m.  Attorney Martin J Lipske appeared by video for Melissa M Robison.  Prosecuting attorney Matthew J Tingstad appeared by Zoom audio for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls case, cites appearances.  Def FTA.  Nothing RUMS.  Atty Lipske provides background.  Requests another STC on case.  Case set for 11/14 at 10:30 a.m.  DA does not request warrant at this time.  Court advises def to appear at next hearing.    Atty Lipske questions address.  Adj.  10:55 a.m.  klr
Status conference on October 24, 2022 at 10:40 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Def shall not drive without a valid driver's license.

9:33 a.m.  Court calls case.  Martin Lipske appears for def via Zoom.  Def appears via Zoom audio.  Matthew J. Tingstad appears for the State of WI.  ATty Lipske is unsure if he is appointed in other case.  22CF29 also referenced.  Atty Lipske would like PTC to be set.  Court references 22CF29.  Warrant is cancelled.  DA requests sig bond of $500 with prohibition that def not drive without valid DL.  Court sets as requested and explains bond.  Def ackw rct of complaint/waives reading.  Also waives time limits to prelinm.  PTC to be set.  Court grants waiver of TL.  21CF39:  Court addresses.  Case to be set for PTC on 8/10 at 10:00 a.m. Adj.  9:42 a.m.  klr

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: 10:16 AM Defendant Melissa M Robison not in court.  Matthew J Tingstad appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Summons and complaint filed today but bond and PC hearing held on 5/10.  Def was given prior hearing date in court.  Court authorizes warrant.  Def to post $500 to quash/Monday to appear.  Adj.  10:17 a.m.  klr

ROBISON, MELISSA:  05/10/22 PCS/JD  5/10/22 PC/Bond Hearing Minutes:  1:27 p.m.  Court calls case.  Def appears in person, in custody.  PC statement provided to Court.  Court reads charges and from police report.  Lt. Foryan sworn in, direct by Court.  Officer identifies defendant.  Court finds PC to set bail.  Public Def info provided.  $500 cash requested.  No objection to bond.  Court sets as requested.  No questions.  5/23 at 9:00 for next hearing.  Adj.  1:31 p.m.  klr
